Package chess.model.moves

Class Movement

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.moves.Movable
chess.model.moves.Movement
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RegularMove
public abstract class Movement extends Movable
An abstract and generic internal representation of a movement.

The concrete subclasses of this abstract class are primarily used to represent:

  1. a legal candidate movement for a Chess piece used internally to validate player-initiated movements;
  2. a reversible (undo) and reproducible (redo) transformation that leads to a certain state of the Chess game.
In addition to the information defined in Movable, this entity captures the following additional information to describes a movement:
  1. The target piece of the movement.
  2. Whether the movement will check the opponent.
All concrete subclasses of this abstract class should only be instantiated by subclasses of Piece, maintained and managed by ChessGame, and used by built-in user interfaces (i.e. any subtype of Interface).

      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • decode

      public static Movement decode(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject, Chessboard chessboard)
      Constructs an appropriate concrete subtype of Movement from a JSON object containing the following required key-value mappings: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     "initialPosition":"<position>",
     "finalPosition":"<position>",
     "type":"<type>",
     "pieceId":"<id>",
     "willCheckOpponent":<true/false>,
     ...
 }
      where:
      • <type>: one of the class names of all the concrete subtypes of Movement (returned from this.getClass().getSimpleName());
      • <id>: the Version 4 UUID string of the movement's target piece;
      Note: Specific movement types such as Capture and Castling require additional key-value mappings which are just as compulsory as those listed above.
      Parameters:
      jsonObject - The source JSONObject from which to decode.
      chessboard - The chessboard from which the pieces are to be referenced.
      This will be passed into subtype constructors for validation purposes.
      Returns:
      An instance of Movement decoded from the given JSON source.
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - If any of the required keys is missing or maps to an invalid value type.
      FormatException - If one of the following scenarios occurs:
      1. failed to resolve a piece with <id> in chessboard;
      2. type is invalid;
      3. TwoSquareAdvance or EnPassantCapture got a non-Pawn target piece;
      4. Castling got a non-King target piece or a non-Rook piece for its target Rook;
      5. any other exception-al condition outlined in the subtypes is satisfied.
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
      See Also:
      • encode()
      • RegularMove(JSONObject, Chessboard)
      • TwoSquareAdvance(JSONObject, Chessboard)
      • Capture(JSONObject, Chessboard)
      • EnPassantCapture(JSONObject, Chessboard)
      • Castling(JSONObject, Chessboard)

    • encode

      public org.json.JSONObject encode()
      Serializes this Movement to a JSON object of the following format: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     "initialPosition":"<position>",
     "finalPosition":"<position>",
     "type":"<type>",
     "pieceId":"<id>",
     "willCheckOpponent": <true/false>
 }
      where:
      • <type>: the class name of this movement returned from this.getClass().getSimpleName();
      • <id>: the Version 4 UUID string of the target piece of this movement.
      Specified by:
      encode in interface chess.persistence.Codable
      Overrides:
      encode in class Movable
      Returns:
      A serialized object ready to be written.
      See Also:
      • Movable.encode()

    • execute

      public int execute(Chessboard chessboard)
      Executes/reproduces the receiver movement on a given chessboard and increments the move count of the target piece.

      The default template method only increments the target piece's move count and returns 0 points.

      It should be overridden by the concrete subclasses of this abstract class to specify movement-specific undo/reverse logic and the number of points associated with this movement.

      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard on which the movement is executed.
      Returns:
      0 points by default.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.
      NoSuchElementException - If no piece with pieceId is found on chessboard.

    • undo

      public int undo(Chessboard chessboard)
      Undoes/reverses the receiver movement on a given chessboard and decrements the move count of the target piece.

      The default template method only decrements the target piece's move count and returns 0 points.

      It should be overridden by the concrete subclasses of this abstract class to specify movement-specific undo/reverse logic and the number of points associated with this movement.

      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard on which the movement is undone/reversed.
      Returns:
      0 points by default.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.
      NoSuchElementException - If no piece with pieceId is found on chessboard.

    • getPieceFrom

      public final Piece getPieceFrom(Chessboard chessboard)
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard.
      Returns:
      The target piece of this movement on the given chessboard.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If no piece with pieceId is found on chessboard.

    • toString

      public final String toString(Chessboard chessboard)
      The string representation of this movement is of the form: 
       <from><descriptor>→<to>
      where:
      • <from> is in the form: ♟@<position>;
      • <descriptor> is the movement-specific descriptor text returned from getDescriptor();
      • <to> is the movement-specific destination representation returned from getDestinationString(Chessboard).
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard from which the target piece is resolved.
      Returns:
      The string representation of this movement.

    • getPieceId

      public String getPieceId()
      Returns:
      The Version 4 UUID string of the target piece of this movement.
